info.title: F5 Distributed Cloud Services API for ves.io.schema.api_sec.rule_suggestion
info.description: APIs to get rule suggestions from App Security Monitoring pages

post.description: Suggest API endpoint protection rule for a given path

401.description: Returned when operation is not authorized

403.description: Returned when there is no permission to access resource

404.description: Returned when resource is not found

409.description: Returned when operation on resource is conflicting with current value

429.description: Returned when operation has been rejected as it is happening too frequently

500.description: Returned when server encountered an error in processing API

503.description: Returned when service is unavailable temporarily

504.description: Returned when server timed out processing request

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description:
Namespace

x-example: "shared"
x-required
Namespace of the App type for current request

common_wafAPIEndpointProtectionRule.description: API Protection Rule for a specific endpoint
common_wafAPIEndpointProtectionRule.title: API Endpoint Protection Rule

api_endpoint_path.description:
The endpoint (path) of the request.

Example: ` "/endpoint1"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_len: 1024
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.templated_http_path: true
api_endpoint_path.title: api endpoint path

specific_domain.description:
Exclusive with [any_domain]
 The rule will apply for a specific domain.
 For example: api.example.com

Example: ` "api.example.com"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_len: 128
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.vh_domain: true
specific_domain.title: domain

common_wafFallThroughRule.description: Fall Through Rule for a specific endpoint, base-path, or API group
common_wafFallThroughRule.title: Fall Through Rule

api_group.description:
Exclusive with [api_endpoint base_path]
 The API group which this validation applies to

Example: ` "oas-all-operations"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_len: 128
api_group.title: api_group

base_path.description:
Exclusive with [api_endpoint api_group]
 The base path which this validation applies to

Example: ` "/api/v1"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.http_path: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_len: 128
base_path.title: base path

threshold.description:
The total number of allowed requests for 1 unit (e.g. SECOND/MINUTE/HOUR etc.) of the specified period.

Example: ` "1"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.gt: 0
  ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.lte: 8192
threshold.title: threshold

common_wafOpenApiFallThroughMode.description:
x-required
Determine what to do with unprotected endpoints (not in the OpenAPI specification file (a.k.a. swagger) or doesn't have a specific rule in custom rules)
common_wafOpenApiFallThroughMode.title: Fall Through Mode

common_wafOpenApiValidationCommonSetting.description: OpenAPI specification validation settings relevant for "API Inventory" enforcement and for "Custom list" enforcement
common_wafOpenApiValidationCommonSetting.title: OpenAPI specification validation common settings

common_wafOpenApiValidationMode.description:
x-required
Validation mode of OpenAPI specification.
 When a validation mismatch occurs on a request to one of the endpoints listed on the OpenAPI specification file (a.k.a. swagger)
common_wafOpenApiValidationMode.title: Validation Mode

common_wafOpenApiValidationModeActive.title: Open API Validation Mode Active For Request

common_wafOpenApiValidationModeActiveRes.title: Open API Validation Mode Active For Response

fields.description:
List of JSON Path field values. Use square brackets with an underscore [_] to indicate array elements (e.g., person.emails[_]). To reference JSON keys that contain spaces, enclose the entire path in double quotes. For example: "person.first name".

Example: ` "['user.email', 'credit_card']"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.items.string.json_path: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.items.string.max_bytes: 256
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.items.string.min_bytes: 1
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.items.string.not_empty: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.max_items: 16
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.min_items: 1
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.unique: true
fields.title: Field Values

http_loadbalancerSensitiveDataTypes.description: Settings to mask sensitive data in request/response payload
http_loadbalancerSensitiveDataTypes.title: Sensitive Data Types

ioschemaObjectRefType.description:
This type establishes a 'direct reference' from one object(the referrer) to another(the referred).
Such a reference is in form of tenant/namespace/name for public API and Uid for private API
This type of reference is called direct because the relation is explicit and concrete (as opposed
to selector reference which builds a group based on labels of selectee objects)
ioschemaObjectRefType.title: ObjectRefType

kind.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then kind will hold the referred object's kind (e.g. "route")

Example: ` "virtual_site"`
kind.title: kind

name.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then name will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) name.

Example: ` "contactus-route"`
name.title: name

namespace.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then namespace will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) namespace.

Example: ` "ns1"`
namespace.title: namespace

tenant.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then tenant will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) tenant.

Example: ` "acmecorp"`
tenant.title: tenant

uid.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then uid will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) uid.

Example: ` "d15f1fad-4d37-48c0-8706-df1824d76d31"`
uid.title: uid

policyAsnMatchList.description: An unordered set of RFC 6793 defined 4-byte AS numbers that can be used to create allow or deny lists for use in network policy or service policy. It can be used to create the allow list only for DNS Load Balancer.
policyAsnMatchList.title: Asn Match List

as_numbers.description:
An unordered set of RFC 6793 defined 4-byte AS numbers that can be used to create allow or deny lists for use in network policy or service policy. It can be used to create the allow list only for DNS Load Balancer.

Example: ` "[713, 7932, 847325, 4683, 15269, 1000001]"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.max_items: 16
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.min_items: 1
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.unique: true
as_numbers.title: as numbers

policyAsnMatcherType.description: Match any AS number contained in the list of bgp_asn_sets.
policyAsnMatcherType.title: asn matcher type

asn_sets.description:
A list of references to bgp_asn_set objects.

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.max_items: 4
asn_sets.title: asn_sets

policyClientMatcher.description: Client conditions for matching a rule
policyClientMatcher.title: Client Matcher

policyCookieMatcherType.description:
A cookie matcher specifies the name of a single cookie and the criteria to match it. The input has a list of values for each
cookie in the request.
A cookie matcher can check for one of the following:
* Presence or absence of the cookie
* At least one of the values for the cookie in the request satisfies the MatcherType item
policyCookieMatcherType.title: CookieMatcherType

invert_matcher.description: Invert Match of the expression defined
invert_matcher.title: invert_matcher

name.description:
A case-sensitive cookie name.

Example: ` "Session"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_bytes: 256
name.title: name

policyHttpMethodMatcherType.description:
A http method matcher specifies a list of methods to match an input HTTP method. The match is considered successful if the input method is a member of the list.
The result of the match based on the method list is inverted if invert_matcher is true.
policyHttpMethodMatcherType.title: HttpMethodMatcherType

methods.description:
List of methods values to match against.

Example: ` "['GET', 'POST', 'DELETE']"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.items.enum.defined_only: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.max_items: 16
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.unique: true
methods.title: methods

policyIPThreatCategory.description:
The IP threat categories to use when a policy based IP threat category is configured.

 - SPAM_SOURCES: SPAM_SOURCES

 - WINDOWS_EXPLOITS: WINDOWS_EXPLOITS

 - WEB_ATTACKS: WEB_ATTACKS

 - BOTNETS: BOTNETS

 - SCANNERS: SCANNERS

 - REPUTATION: REPUTATION

 - PHISHING: PHISHING

 - PROXY: PROXY

 - MOBILE_THREATS: MOBILE_THREATS

 - TOR_PROXY: TOR_PROXY

 - DENIAL_OF_SERVICE: DENIAL_OF_SERVICE

 - NETWORK: NETWORK
policyIPThreatCategory.title: IP Threat Category

policyIpMatcherType.description:
Match any ip prefix contained in the list of ip_prefix_sets.
The result of the match is inverted if invert_matcher is true.
policyIpMatcherType.title: ip matcher type

prefix_sets.description:
A list of references to ip_prefix_set objects.

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.max_items: 4
prefix_sets.title: prefix_sets

policyJWTClaimMatcherType.description:
A JWT claim matcher specifies the name of a single JWT claim and the criteria for the input request to match it.
The input has a list of actual values for each JWT claim name in the JWT payload.
A JWT claim matcher can check for one of the following:
* Presence or absence of the JWT Claim in the input
* At least one of the values for the JWT Claim in the input satisfies the MatcherType item
policyJWTClaimMatcherType.title: JWTClaimMatcherType

name.description:
JWT claim name.

Example: ` "user_id"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_bytes: 256
name.title: name

policyKnownTlsFingerprintClass.description:
Specifies known TLS fingerprint classes

 - TLS_FINGERPRINT_NONE: TLS_FINGERPRINT_NONE

No TLS fingerprint
 - ANY_MALICIOUS_FINGERPRINT: ANY_MALICIOUS_FINGERPRINT

TLS fingerprints known to be associated with malicious clients
 - ADWARE: ADWARE

TLS fingerprints known to be associated with adware
 - ADWIND: ADWIND

TLS fingerprints known to be associated with adwind
 - DRIDEX: DRIDEX

TLS fingerprints known to be associated with dridex
 - GOOTKIT: GOOTKIT

TLS fingerprints known to be associated with gootkit
 - GOZI: GOZI

TLS fingerprints known to be associated with gozi
 - JBIFROST: JBIFROST

TLS fingerprints known to be associated with jbifrost
 - QUAKBOT: QUAKBOT

TLS fingerprints known to be associated with quakbot
 - RANSOMWARE: RANSOMWARE

TLS fingerprints known to be associated with ransomware
 - TROLDESH: TROLDESH

TLS fingerprints known to be associated with troldesh
 - TOFSEE: TOFSEE

TLS fingerprints known to be associated with tofsee
 - TORRENTLOCKER: TORRENTLOCKER

TLS fingerprints known to be associated with torrentlocker
 - TRICKBOT: TRICKBOT

TLS fingerprints known to be associated with trickbot
policyKnownTlsFingerprintClass.title: TLS known fingerprint class

policyMatcherType.description:
A matcher specifies multiple criteria for matching an input string. The match is considered successful if any of the criteria are satisfied. The set
of supported match criteria includes a list of exact values and a list of regular expressions.
policyMatcherType.title: MatcherType

exact_values.description:
A list of exact values to match the input against.

Example: ` "['new york', 'london', 'sydney', 'tokyo', 'cairo']"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.items.string.max_bytes: 256
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.items.string.not_empty: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.max_items: 64
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.unique: true
exact_values.title: exact values

regex_values.description:
A list of regular expressions to match the input against.

Example: ` "['^new .*$', 'san f.*', '.* del .*']"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.items.string.max_bytes: 256
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.items.string.not_empty: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.items.string.regex: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.max_items: 16
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.unique: true
regex_values.title: regex values

transformers.description:
An ordered list of transformers (starting from index 0) to be applied to the path before matching.

Example: ` "[BASE64_DECODE, LOWER_CASE]`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.max_items: 9
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.unique: true
transformers.title: transformers

policyPrefixMatchList.description: List of IP Prefix strings to match against.
policyPrefixMatchList.title: IP Prefix Match List

ip_prefixes.description:
List of IPv4 prefix strings.

Example: ` "192.168.20.0/24"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.items.string.ipv4_prefix: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.items.string.not_empty: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.max_items: 128
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.unique: true
ip_prefixes.title: ip prefixes

policyRequestMatcher.description: Request conditions for matching a rule
policyRequestMatcher.title: Request Matcher

cookie_matchers.description:
A list of predicates for all cookies that need to be matched. The criteria for matching each cookie is described in individual instances
 of CookieMatcherType. The actual cookie values are extracted from the request API as a list of strings for each cookie name.
 Note that all specified cookie matcher predicates must evaluate to true.

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.max_items: 16
cookie_matchers.title: cookie matchers

headers.description:
A list of predicates for various HTTP headers that need to match. The criteria for matching each HTTP header are described in individual HeaderMatcherType
 instances. The actual HTTP header values are extracted from the request API as a list of strings for each HTTP header type.
 Note that all specified header predicates must evaluate to true.

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.max_items: 16
headers.title: headers

jwt_claims.description:
A list of predicates for various JWT claims that need to match. The criteria for matching each JWT claim are described in individual JWTClaimMatcherType
 instances. The actual JWT claims values are extracted from the JWT payload as a list of strings.
 Note that all specified JWT claim predicates must evaluate to true.
 Note that this feature only works on LBs with JWT Validation feature enabled.

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.max_items: 16
jwt_claims.title: JWT claims

query_params.description:
A list of predicates for all query parameters that need to be matched. The criteria for matching each query parameter are described in individual instances
 of QueryParameterMatcherType. The actual query parameter values are extracted from the request API as a list of strings for each query parameter name.
 Note that all specified query parameter predicates must evaluate to true.

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.max_items: 16
query_params.title: query params

policyTlsFingerprintMatcherType.description:
A TLS fingerprint matcher specifies multiple criteria for matching a TLS fingerprint. The set of supported positve match criteria includes a list of known
classes of TLS fingerprints and a list of exact values. The match is considered successful if either of these positive criteria are satisfied and the input
fingerprint is not one of the excluded values.
policyTlsFingerprintMatcherType.title: TlsFingerprintMatcherType

classes.description:
A list of known classes of TLS fingerprints to match the input TLS JA3 fingerprint against.

Example: ` "['ADWARE', 'TRICKBOT']`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.max_items: 16
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.unique: true
classes.title: classes

exact_values.description:
A list of exact TLS JA3 fingerprints to match the input TLS JA3 fingerprint against.

Example: ` "['ed6dfd54b01ebe31b7a65b88abfa7297', '16efcf0e00504ddfedde13bfea997952', 'de364c46b0dfc283b5e38c79ceae3f8f']"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.items.string.len: 32
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.max_items: 16
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.unique: true
exact_values.title: exact values

excluded_values.description:
A list of TLS JA3 fingerprints to be excluded when matching the input TLS JA3 fingerprint. This can be used to skip known false positives when using one
 or more known TLS fingerprint classes in the enclosing matcher.

Example: ` "['fb00055a1196aeea8d1bc609885ba953', 'b386946a5a44d1ddcc843bc75336dfce']"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.items.string.len: 32
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.max_items: 32
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.unique: true
excluded_values.title: excluded values

policyTransformer.description:
Transformers to be applied on the part of the request before matching.

 - TRANSFORMER_NONE: transformer none

No transformers enabled
 - LOWER_CASE: lower case

Convert string to lower case
 - UPPER_CASE: upper case

Convert string to upper case
 - BASE64_DECODE: base64 decode

Decode string assuming base64 encoding
 - NORMALIZE_PATH: normalize path

Normalize URL path so that /a/b/../c will be transformed to /a/c
 - REMOVE_WHITESPACE: remove whitespace

Remove whitespaces
 - URL_DECODE: URL decode

Decode string assuming URL encoding as per rfc1738
 - TRIM_LEFT: trim left

Remove whitespace from the left side of the input string
 - TRIM_RIGHT: trim right

Remove whitespace from the right side of the input string
 - TRIM: trim

Remove whitespace from the both sides of the input string
policyTransformer.title: Transformer

rate_limiterRateLimitPeriodUnit.description:
Unit for the period per which the rate limit is applied.

 - SECOND: Second

Rate limit period unit is seconds
 - MINUTE: Minute

Rate limit period unit is minutes
 - HOUR: Hour

Rate limit period unit is hours
 - DAY: Day

Rate limit period unit is days
rate_limiterRateLimitPeriodUnit.title: RateLimitPeriodUnit

schemaEmpty.description: This can be used for messages where no values are needed
schemaEmpty.title: Empty

schemaHttpMethod.description:
Specifies the HTTP method used to access a resource.

Any HTTP Method
schemaHttpMethod.title: HttpMethod

schemaLabelSelectorType.description:
This type can be used to establish a 'selector reference' from one object(called selector) to
a set of other objects(called selectees) based on the value of expresssions.
A label selector is a label query over a set of resources. An empty label selector matches all objects.
A null label selector matches no objects. Label selector is immutable.
expressions is a list of strings of label selection expression.
Each string has "," separated values which are "AND" and all strings are logically "OR".
BNF for expression string
<selector-syntax>         ::= <requirement> | <requirement> "," <selector-syntax>
<requirement>             ::= [!] KEY [ <set-based-restriction> | <exact-match-restriction> ]
<set-based-restriction>   ::= "" | <inclusion-exclusion> <value-set>
<inclusion-exclusion>     ::= <inclusion> | <exclusion>
<exclusion>               ::= "notin"
<inclusion>               ::= "in"
<value-set>               ::= "(" <values> ")"
<values>                  ::= VALUE | VALUE "," <values>
<exact-match-restriction> ::= ["="|"=="|"!="] VALUE
schemaLabelSelectorType.title: LabelSelectorType

expressions.description:
expressions contains the kubernetes style label expression for selections.

Example: ` "region in (us-west1, us-west2),tier in (staging)"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.items.string.k8s_label_selector: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.items.string.max_len: 4096
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.items.string.min_len: 1
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.max_items: 1
expressions.title: expressions

schemaMessageMetaType.description:
MessageMetaType is metadata (common attributes) of a message that only certain messages
have. This information is propagated to the metadata of a child object that gets created
from the containing message during view processing.
The information in this type can be specified by user during create and replace APIs.
schemaMessageMetaType.title: MessageMetaType

description.description:
Human readable description.

Example: ` "Virtual Host for acmecorp website"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_len: 256
description.title: description

name.description:
This is the name of the message.
 The value of name has to follow DNS-1035 format.

Example: ` "acmecorp-web"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.min_len: 1
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.ves_object_name: true
name.title: name

schemaOpenApiValidationProperties.description:
List of required properties to validate against the OpenAPI spec

Validate that all query parameters are according to the OpenAPI specification
Validate that all path parameters are according to the OpenAPI specification
Validate that the content type of the request is according to the OpenAPI specification
Validate that all cookies are according to the OpenAPI specification
Validate that all HTTP headers are according to the OpenAPI specification
Validate that the body is according to the OpenAPI specification
Validate that the security schema is according to the OpenAPI specification
Validate that the response code is according to the OpenAPI specification
schemaOpenApiValidationProperties.title: OpenApiValidationProperties

schemapolicyHeaderMatcherType.description:
A header matcher specifies the name of a single HTTP header and the criteria for the input request to match it. The input has a list of actual values for each
header name in the original HTTP request.
A header matcher can check for one of the following:
* Presence or absence of the header in the input
* At least one of the values for the header in the input satisfies the MatcherType item
schemapolicyHeaderMatcherType.title: HeaderMatcherType

name.description:
A case-insensitive HTTP header name.

Example: ` "Accept-Encoding"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.http_header_field: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_bytes: 256
name.title: name

ip_threat_categories.description:
The IP threat categories is obtained from the list and is used to auto-generate equivalent label selection expressions

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.max_items: 32
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.unique: true
ip_threat_categories.title: IP Threat Categories
ip_threat_categories.x-displayname: List of IP Threat Categories to choose

schemapolicyQueryParameterMatcherType.description:
A query parameter matcher specifies the name of a single query parameter and the criteria for the input request to match it. The input has a list of actual
values for each query parameter name in the original HTTP request.
A query parameter matcher can check for one of the following:
* Presence or absence of the query parameter in the input
* At least one of the values for the query parameter in the input satisfies the MatcherType item
schemapolicyQueryParameterMatcherType.title: QueryParameterMatcherType

key.description:
A case-sensitive HTTP query parameter name.

Example: ` "sourceid"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_bytes: 256
key.title: key

schemaviewsObjectRefType.description:
This type establishes a direct reference from one object(the referrer) to another(the referred).
Such a reference is in form of tenant/namespace/name
schemaviewsObjectRefType.title: ObjectRefType

name.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then name will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) name.

Example: ` "contacts-route"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_bytes: 128
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.min_bytes: 1
name.title: name

namespace.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then namespace will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) namespace.

Example: ` "ns1"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_bytes: 64
namespace.title: namespace

tenant.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then tenant will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) tenant.

Example: ` "acmecorp"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_bytes: 64
tenant.title: tenant

virtual_hostVirtualHostType.description:
VirtualHostType tells the type of virtual_host. Functionally, all types are same,
this is mainly used for categorizing metrics.

 - VIRTUAL_SERVICE: VirtualService

Virtual Host used Virtual Service
 - HTTP_LOAD_BALANCER: HTTP LoadBalancer

Virtual Host used as Load Balancer
 - API_GATEWAY: APIGateway

Virtual Host used API Gateway
 - TCP_LOAD_BALANCER: TCP LoadBalancer

Virtual Host used as Load Balancer
 - PROXY: Proxy

Virtual Host used as Proxy
 - LOCAL_K8S_API_GATEWAY: LOCAL_K8S_API_GATEWAY

Internal use only, used for k8s cluster api gateway on the site.
 - CDN_LOAD_BALANCER: CDN LoadBalancer

 Virtual Host used as Load Balancer
 - NGINX_SERVER: NGINX Server

Virtual Host representing an NGINX Server block
 - BIGIP_VIRTUAL_SERVER: BIG-IP Virtual Server

Virtual Host representing a BIG-IP Virtual Server
 - UDP_LOAD_BALANCER: UDP LoadBalancer

Virtual Host used as Load Balancer
 - THIRD_PARTY_APPLICATION: THIRD PARTY Virtual Server

Virtual Host representing a Third Party Application
virtual_hostVirtualHostType.title: VirtualHostType
